meanings.definition: A unit of measurement equal to one-millionth of the force of gravity on Earth.
meanings.sent1: Scientists study microgravities to understand how objects behave in very weak gravitational forces.
meanings.sent2: Astronauts experience microgravities in space, where gravity is extremely low.
meanings.sent3: In microgravities, even a small push can send objects floating around unpredictably.
meanings.sent4: The concept of microgravities is like being in a constant state of weightlessness.
meanings.sent5: Imagine a world where everything is in microgravities, and you can jump as high as you want!

meanings.definition: The condition of experiencing very weak gravitational forces.
meanings.sent1: The astronauts felt the effects of microgravities as they floated effortlessly in space.
meanings.sent2: Microgravities can make it challenging to perform certain tasks that require gravity.
meanings.sent3: Trying to walk in microgravities feels like moving in slow motion.
meanings.sent4: The sensation of microgravities is like being gently lifted off the ground.
meanings.sent5: In microgravities, even the smallest movements can have a big impact on your surroundings.
